newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - March 3.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - March 3.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on March 3. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
The minority United Development Party (PPP) threatened over the weekend to ignore the government's election campaign rules unless they were revised.

The People's Consultative Assembly (MPR) has never considered, much less discussed, holding a special session to assess the capability of President Suharto, according to deputy speaker Ismail Hasan Metareum.
The United Development Party (PPP) said in a statement that the election rules are discriminative against participating organisations, especially the PPP.
An official from the Bakrie Group said Bank Perniagaan and Bank Nasional will soon merge.
Economic disincentives are forcing Indonesian companies to invest abroad, economists said.

The ruling Golkar party has removed four people from the temporary list of candidates for the May general election after two withdrew their own candidacy and two others were removed for moral reasons.
